alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 11:55AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong winds associated with a wake low will impact portions of St. Bernard, Orleans, St. Tammany, northern Lafourche, Jefferson, St. John The Baptist, Ascension, St. James, St. Charles, southeastern St. Helena, Livingston, Tangipahoa, Plaquemines, northeastern Assumption and southern Washington Parishes, Harrison, Hancock and southern Pearl River Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 1153 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong winds in association with a wake low along a line extending from near Roseland to near Napoleonville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Gulfport, Biloxi, Slidell, Hammond, Long Beach, Thibodaux, Bogalusa, Picayune, Gonzales, Bay St. Louis, Covington, Donaldsonville, Waveland, Franklinton, Napoleonville, Reserve, Amite, Avondale and East New Orleans. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 176 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 39. Interstate 12 between mile markers 18 and 84. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 66. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 20. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison
